Intervals

pba.interval Module

Classes

Interval([left, right])

An interval is an uncertain number for which only the endpoints are known, for example if \(x=[a,b]\) then this can be interpreted as \(x\) being between \(a\) and \(b\) but with no more information about the value of \(x\) . Intervals can be created using:: pba.I(left,right) pba.Interval(left,right).

I

alias of pba.interval.Interval

Logical(left[, right])

Imprecise Boolean object
